title: After Deadly Earthquake in Afghanistan, Emergency Aid Trickles In
summary: Villages remain cut off in the remote, mountainous areas in the east that have been hardest hit by the disaster, which has killed at least 1,400 people.

title: Landslide Kills Hundreds in Sudan
summary: The landslide leveled a village in the remote Marra mountains, a local rebel group said. Its leader appealed for urgent help, saying, “This is a nightmare.”

title: Scientists Denounce Trump Administration’s Climate Report
summary: Scores of researchers reviewed the Energy Department’s argument about greenhouse gases and found serious deficiencies.

title: White House Counsel Eases Trump’s Path on Aggressive Agenda
summary: David Warrington, the top lawyer inside the West Wing, focuses on “the art of the possible,” as one Trump adviser said.

title: House Oversight Committee Is Set to Meet With Accusers of Jeffrey Epstein
summary: Lawmakers are continuing their inquiry into Mr. Epstein, the disgraced financier, despite the Trump administration’s efforts to quell public demand for information.

title: In Protest, He Turned the Camera on China’s Surveillance State
summary: Before fleeing China, an activist in Chongqing staged an elaborate one-man demonstration against the Communist Party that doubled as performance art.

title: Ukraine Pursues a Weapons Buildup More Potent Than Any Security Guarantee
summary: Kyiv sees a well-equipped army as a stronger deterrent to Moscow than any Western pledges to defend it. It is working to attract billions to buy more arms.

title: Putin and Xi Invoke Wartime Unity as They Hail Ties in Beijing
summary: The Russian and Chinese leaders drew on a shared view of their countries’ roles in World War II to cast their modern-day partnership as a challenge to the West.

title: The Millionaire Who Left Wall Street to Become a Paramedic
summary: After making millions in a job he came to hate, Jonathan Kleisner joined the Fire Department as a rookie paramedic at the age of 41. Now he’s determined to be the best rescue medic anywhere.

title: How Jair Bolsonaro Tried, and Failed, to Stage a Coup in Brazil
summary: Brazil’s former president, Jair Bolsonaro, stands trial on Tuesday, accused of plotting a coup after losing the 2022 elections. Evidence suggests this is how he tried to do it.

title: Jair Bolsonaro, Charged With Plotting a Coup, Is Not at His Trial
summary: Brazil’s Supreme Court began judging the case against the former president, who did not attend the proceedings because of poor health, his defense team said.

title: What Does Vogue Mean Today?
summary: The magazine has a new editor in Chloe Malle. It may also need a new identity.

title: Vogue Names Chloe Malle as Its New Editor
summary: Ms. Malle, 39, succeeds Anna Wintour, a titan in fashion. “There has to be a noticeable shift that makes this mine,” Ms. Malle said in an interview.

title: ‘Who Am I Without Birth Control?’
summary: As social media and wellness podcasters bombard young women with messages about the pill, many are questioning what they’ve long been told.

title: Is ‘The Wizard of Oz’ at Sphere the Future of Cinema? Or the End of It?
summary: Our critic went to Las Vegas to see the immersive presentation of the classic 1939 film. What she saw defied easy categorization.

title: After Court Defeat, Trump Warns of Economic Chaos From Loss of Tariffs
summary: The president and his advisers have suggested they will fight a federal appeals court’s ruling that found many of the administration’s tariffs to be illegal.

title: A Move to the U.S. to Avoid Tariffs? There Are Trade-Offs.
summary: Bizerba, a German company that makes industrial slicers for Subway, is thinking about shifting production to the United States, if it can overcome the challenges.

title: Giuliani Finds a Home Away From Home in New Hampshire
summary: Before his car crash, the former mayor of New York City was taking in a minor-league baseball game in Manchester, N.H., a city where he’s been known to enjoy a good cigar.

title: Poor Amazon Rains Linked to Brazil Deforestation
summary: Deforestation is playing a greater role than researchers expected, according to a new study.

title: Animal Activists Target Farmers in Sonoma, Known as ‘America’s Provence’
summary: A new generation of activists has used extreme tactics and viral video to challenge farmers in Sonoma County, a region known for some of the industry’s most humane practices.

title: The One Danger That Should Unite the U.S. and China
summary: The U.S. and China must agree on a trust architecture for A.I., or rogue entities will destabilize the two superpowers long before they fight a war.

title: Forced Drug Treatment Isn’t Horrific. It’s a Relief.
summary: Besides, addicted people are not the only ones affected by their behavior.

title: We Answer Your Questions About Education
summary: Our reporters address reader concerns about K-12 schooling.

title: Reduced Screening May Have Led to Rise in Advanced Prostate Cancer Diagnoses
summary: Changes in screening recommendations over a decade ago may have inadvertently resulted in later diagnosis of the most common cancer in men, a new study has found.

title: Maduro Says War With Venezuela Would Stain Trump’s Hands with Blood
summary: As U.S. warships and troops gather in the Caribbean, Mr. Maduro threatened an “armed fight” in response to any military action. He also appealed for peace.

title: How Protests, Tear Gas and Looting Roiled Indonesia
summary: Deep-rooted resentment between the haves and have-nots set off a wave of antigovernment protests that have turned violent.

title: Kraft Heinz to Split Into Two Businesses
summary: Food companies are coming under pressure for growth as the maker of Velveeta breaks up and an activist investor takes a stake in PepsiCo.
